recipes.name: Saudi Arabia Kabsa
recipes.cooking_method: To prepare the Kabsa, follow these steps: Rinse the Basmati Rice in cold water and soak it for 15 minutes. Cut the Chicken into pieces and wash them thoroughly. In a large pot, heat the Vegetable Oil over medium heat and fry the Onion until it becomes translucent. Add the Chicken to the pot and fry until it is browned on all sides. Add the Garlic, Tomatoes, Carrot, Green Chilies, Black Pepper, Cinnamon Stick, and Cardamom Pods to the pot and fry for a few minutes until the vegetables are slightly softened. Add the soaked Basmati Rice to the pot and fry for a few minutes until the rice is coated with oil and the vegetables are well mixed. Add the Cumin Powder, Coriander Powder, Turmeric Powder, and Salt to the pot and mix well. Add Water to the pot and bring it to a boil. Then, reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and let it simmer for about 30 minutes or until the rice and chicken are fully cooked and the water is absorbed. Once the Kabsa is fully cooked, turn off the heat and let it rest for a few minutes. Serve the Kabsa hot with your choice of garnish, such as chopped fresh Cilantro or fried Onions.

recipes.name: Saudi Mutabbaq
recipes.cooking_method: To prepare Saudi Mutabbaq, follow these steps: In a large mixing bowl, combine the All-Purpose Flour, Water, and Salt. Knead the mixture well to form a soft and smooth dough. Cover the dough and let it rest for about 30 minutes. In a skillet, heat the Vegetable Oil over medium heat. Add the Onion and fry until it becomes translucent. Add the Ground Beef or Lamb to the skillet and fry until it is browned. Add the Tomatoes, Green Chilies, Cumin Powder, Coriander Powder, Turmeric Powder, and Salt. Mix the ingredients well and let the mixture cook until the tomatoes are softened and the spices are well combined. Divide the dough into equal-sized balls. Using a rolling pin, roll out each ball into a thin circular shape. Add a spoonful of the cooked meat mixture to the center of each rolled-out dough circle. Beat the Egg in a small bowl. Brush the edges of the dough circle with the beaten Egg. Fold the dough circle over the meat mixture to create a semi-circle shape. Press the edges together to seal the Mutabbaq. Heat the Vegetable Oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Fry the Mutabbaq until it is golden brown on both sides. Serve the Mutabbaq hot and enjoy!

recipes.name: Shattah
recipes.cooking_method: To prepare Shattah, follow these steps: In a food processor or blender, combine the Red Bell Peppers, Green Chili Peppers, Garlic, Cumin Powder, Coriander Powder, and Salt. Pulse the ingredients until they are well combined and form a paste-like consistency. Transfer the paste to a bowl and stir in the Lemon Juice and Olive Oil. Mix well to combine. Cover the bowl and let the Shattah rest in the refrigerator for at least an hour to allow the flavors to meld together. Serve the Shattah with your favorite dishes for added flavor and heat.

recipes.name: Masoub
ingredients: Pita Bread - 3, toasted and broken into small pieces
recipes.cooking_method: To prepare Masoub, follow these steps: In a large mixing bowl, combine the mashed Bananas and broken Pita Bread pieces. In a separate saucepan, melt the Butter over low heat. Add the Date Syrup, Cinnamon Powder, and Ground Cardamom to the saucepan and stir until the ingredients are well combined. Add the Milk to the saucepan and continue to stir until the mixture is heated through. Pour the warm mixture over the banana and bread mixture and stir until the ingredients are well combined. Spoon the Masoub into serving dishes and garnish with the chopped Roasted Almonds. Serve the Masoub warm and enjoy.

recipes.name: Saudi Champagne
recipes.cooking_method: To prepare a Champagne cocktail, follow these steps: Place the Sugar Cube in the bottom of a Champagne flute or coupe glass. Add the Angostura Bitters onto the Sugar Cube and let it dissolve for a few seconds. Pour the Champagne into the glass, being careful not to overflow. Garnish the cocktail with a twist of Lemon Peel and serve immediately. Enjoy the classic combination of bubbles and sweetness in this elegant cocktail.

recipes.name: Aysh Abu Laham
ingredients: Green Bell Pepper - 1 medium, finely chopped
recipes.cooking_method: To prepare Aysh Abu Laham, follow these steps: In a large mixing bowl, combine the Flour, Sugar, and Salt. In a separate bowl, dissolve the Yeast in the warm Water and add it to the Flour mixture along with the Vegetable Oil. Knead the dough until it becomes smooth and elastic. Cover the bowl with a cloth and let it rest in a warm place for about an hour or until it doubles in size. In a skillet, cook the Ground Beef over medium heat until it's browned. Add the Onion, Tomato, Green Bell Pepper, Parsley, Salt, Black Pepper, Paprika, Cumin, and Lemon Juice to the skillet and stir until the ingredients are well combined. Remove from heat and let it cool. Preheat the oven to 350°F. Divide the dough into small balls and flatten each one with your hands. Place a spoonful of the beef mixture onto the center of each flattened dough and fold the dough around the mixture, forming a ball. Place the balls onto a baking sheet and bake for about 15-20 minutes or until the bread turns golden brown. Remove from the oven and serve warm. Enjoy the delicious combination of bread and savory beef filling in this classic Saudi dish.

recipes.name: Masoub
ingredients: Pita Bread - 3, toasted and broken into small pieces
recipes.cooking_method: To prepare Masoub, follow these steps: In a large mixing bowl, combine the mashed Bananas and broken Pita Bread pieces. In a separate saucepan, melt the Butter over low heat. Add the Date Syrup, Cinnamon Powder, and Ground Cardamom to the saucepan and stir until the ingredients are well combined. Add the Milk to the saucepan and continue to stir until the mixture is heated through. Pour the warm mixture over the banana and bread mixture and stir until the ingredients are well combined. Spoon the Masoub into serving dishes and garnish with the chopped Roasted Almonds. Serve the Masoub warm and enjoy.

recipes.name: Martabak
recipes.cooking_method: To prepare Martabak, follow these steps: In a large mixing bowl, combine the Flour, Sugar, and Salt. In a separate bowl, dissolve the Yeast in the warm Water and add it to the Flour mixture along with the Vegetable Oil. Knead the dough until it becomes smooth and elastic. Cover the bowl with a cloth and let it rest in a warm place for about an hour or until it doubles in size. In a skillet, cook the Ground Beef or Chicken over medium heat until it's browned. Add the Onion, Garlic, Ginger, Green Chilies, Curry Powder, Turmeric Powder, Cumin Powder, Coriander Powder, Salt, and Black Pepper to the skillet and stir until the ingredients are well combined. Remove from heat and let it cool. Preheat a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Divide the dough into small balls and flatten each one with your hands, forming a thin round disk. Place a spoonful of the meat mixture onto the center of each disk and fold the dough around the mixture, forming a square-shaped pocket. Brush the pocket with the beaten Egg on both sides. Heat a small amount of Vegetable Oil in the skillet and fry the pocket until it turns golden brown on both sides. Remove from the skillet and serve hot with your favorite dipping sauce. Enjoy the crispy and savory flavors of this popular Saudi street food

recipes.name: Ful Medames
recipes.cooking_method: To prepare Ful Medames, follow these steps: Rinse and soak the Dried Fava Beans in Water overnight. Drain and rinse the Beans and place them in a large pot with 8 cups of Water. Bring the pot to a boil and then reduce the heat to a simmer. Add the Garlic, Lemon Juice, Olive Oil, Cumin Powder, and Salt to the pot and let it cook for about 1-2 hours or until the Beans are tender. Add more Water if needed. Once the Beans are cooked, remove the pot from the heat and mash the Beans with a fork or a potato masher. Add the chopped Tomato and Onion to the pot and let it cook for a few more minutes until the vegetables are soft. Serve the Ful Medames hot with a sprinkle of Parsley on top.

recipes.name: Hummus
recipes.cooking_method: To prepare Hummus, follow these steps: In a food processor, combine the Chickpeas, Tahini, Garlic, Lemon Juice, Olive Oil, Cumin Powder, and Salt. Pulse the ingredients until they are well blended and smooth. If the mixture is too thick, add Water a little at a time until you reach the desired consistency. Transfer the Hummus to a serving dish and sprinkle with Paprika. Serve the Hummus with Pita bread or vegetables. Enjoy the creamy and flavorful taste of these classic Middle Eastern dishes

recipes.name: Gursan
recipes.cooking_method: To prepare Meat and Vegetable Stew, follow these steps: In a large pot, heat the Olive Oil over medium-high heat. Add the cubed Stewing Beef and cook until browned on all sides. Remove the Beef from the pot and set it aside. In the same pot, add the Onion and Garlic and cook until the Onion is translucent. Add the Tomato Paste and cook for 1-2 minutes. Add the Beef Broth, chopped Carrots, Potatoes, Celery, Green Beans, Bay Leaves, Thyme, Salt, and Black Pepper to the pot. Add enough Water to cover the vegetables and bring the pot to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and let it simmer for about 1-2 hours or until the Beef and vegetables are tender. Adjust the seasoning if needed. Serve the Meat and Vegetable Stew hot and enjoy the hearty and comforting flavors of this classic dish!

recipes.name: Arabian Lamb Stew
ingredients: Lamb Shoulder - 2 lbs, bone-in, cut into pieces
recipes.cooking_method: To prepare Arabian Lamb Stew, follow these steps: In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the Olive Oil over medium-high heat. Add the Lamb Shoulder pieces and cook until browned on all sides. Remove the Lamb from the pot and set it aside. In the same pot, add the Onion, Garlic, and Ginger and cook until the Onion is translucent. Add the chopped Tomatoes, Carrots, Potatoes, Cinnamon Sticks, Cloves, Cardamom Pods, Cumin, Coriander, Turmeric, and Salt to the pot. Stir the ingredients to combine, and cook for a few minutes until fragrant. Add 3 cups of Water to the pot, and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and let it simmer for about 1-2 hours or until the Lamb and vegetables are tender. Adjust the seasoning if needed. Serve the Arabian Lamb Stew hot, garnished with Fresh Cilantro, and with Lemon Wedges on the side to add a bright citrusy flavor. Enjoy the rich and aromatic taste of this delicious stew!

recipes.name: Tharid/ Thareed
ingredients: Lamb or Chicken - 1 lb, boneless, cut into cubes
Bread - 4 pieces of pita bread or 1 large flatbread, torn into pieces
recipes.cooking_method: To prepare Tharid/Thareed, follow these steps: In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat some oil over medium-high heat. Add the Lamb or Chicken pieces and cook until browned on all sides. Remove the meat from the pot and set it aside. In the same pot, add the Onion, Garlic, and Ginger and cook until the Onion is translucent. Add the chopped Tomatoes, Cumin, Coriander, Turmeric, Salt, and Pepper to the pot. Stir the ingredients to combine, and cook for a few minutes until fragrant. Add 4 cups of Water to the pot, and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and let it simmer for about 1 hour or until the meat is tender. Adjust the seasoning if needed. Just before serving, add torn pieces of Bread to the pot, and let them soak up the broth. Serve the Tharid/Thareed hot, garnished with Fresh Cilantro. Enjoy the hearty and comforting flavors of this traditional Arabian dish!

recipes.name: Ruz Al Bukhari
ingredients: Lamb or Chicken - 2 lbs, bone-in, cut into pieces
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Rinse 2 cups of basmati rice several times until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in water for at least 30 minutes. 2. In a large pot, bring 3 1/2 cups of water and 1 tablespoon of salt to a boil. Drain the rice and add it to the pot. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and let the rice cook for about 18 minutes or until the water has been absorbed and the rice is tender. 3. In a separate pan, heat 2 tablespoons of ghee or butter over medium heat. Add 1 cinnamon stick, 2 whole cloves, 2 green cardamom pods, and 1/4 teaspoon of cumin seeds, and fry for about 30 seconds until fragrant. 4. Add 1 finely chopped onion and fry for 3-4 minutes until softened. 5. Add 1/4 cup of raisins, 1/4 cup of slivered almonds, and 1/4 cup of shelled pistachios to the onion mixture, and fry for another minute until the nuts are lightly browned. 6. Fluff the rice with a fork and transfer it to a large serving dish. Spoon the onion and nut mixture over the top of the rice, and serve hot.

recipes.name: Arabian Lamb Stew
ingredients: Lamb Shoulder - 2 lbs, bone-in, cut into pieces
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Rinse 1 cup of whole wheat grains several times until the water runs clear. Soak the grains in water for at least 4 hours, or overnight. 2. In a large pot, bring 6 cups of water to a boil. Drain the soaked wheat grains and add them to the pot. Reduce the heat to low and let the grains simmer for about 2 hours, stirring occasionally, until they become soft and tender. 3. Use an immersion blender or food processor to puree the grains into a smooth paste. 4. In a separate pan, heat 1 tablespoon of ghee or butter over medium heat. Add 1 chopped onion and fry for 3-4 minutes until softened. 5. Add 1/2 teaspoon of cumin to the onion and fry for another minute until fragrant. 6. Add 1/2 cup of cubed chicken or beef to the onion mixture and fry until cooked through. 7. Add the chicken or beef mixture to the pot with the wheat paste and mix well. Add salt to taste. 8. Let the mixture cook on low heat for another 30-40 minutes, stirring occasionally, until it becomes thick and creamy. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Maamoul
recipes.cooking_method: To prepare maamoul: In a large bowl, mix together 2 cups fine semolina, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup powdered sugar, and 1 teaspoon active dry yeast until well combined. Add 3/4 cup melted unsalted butter and mix well with your hands until the dough is smooth and elastic. Cover the dough and let it rest for 30 minutes. In a separate bowl, mix together 2 cups chopped walnuts or pistachios, 1/2 cup powdered sugar, and 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon. Set aside. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C). Take a small piece of dough and roll it into a ball about the size of a golf ball. Flatten the ball with your fingers and place 1 teaspoon of the nut mixture in the center. Pinch the edges of the dough together to seal the filling and form a ball. Repeat with the remaining dough and filling. Place the maamoul balls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and bake for 15-20 minutes or until lightly golden. Allow the maamoul to cool completely before serving

recipes.name: Baklava
recipes.cooking_method: To make Baklava, preheat the oven to 350°F. Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish with butter. Unwrap the phyllo dough and place it on a work surface. Cover with a damp cloth to prevent it from drying out. In a separate bowl, mix the chopped walnuts and melted butter. Take a sheet of phyllo dough and brush it with melted butter. Add another sheet on top and brush with butter again. Repeat this process until you have 6 sheets stacked on top of each other. Spread a layer of the walnut mixture over the phyllo dough. Repeat the phyllo dough layering process until you have used all the phyllo dough, brushing each layer with melted butter. Spread the remaining walnut mixture on top. Cut the baklava into diamond or square shapes using a sharp knife. Bake in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until golden brown. In a small saucepan, combine 1 cup of sugar and 1 cup of water. Bring to a boil and stir until the sugar is dissolved. Add 1/2 cup honey and stir well. Let the mixture cool slightly. Pour the syrup over the baked Baklava while it is still hot. Allow to cool before serving.

recipes.name: Arabian Lamb Stew
ingredients: 1 pound of white cheese (e.g. mozzarella or Akkawi cheese)
recipes.cooking_method: To prepare Knafeh, start by mixing together the semolina flour, sugar, baking powder, and ghee until well combined. Next, spread half of the mixture into a greased baking dish and press it down firmly. Then, add the cheese on top, followed by the remaining semolina mixture. Bake the Knafeh in a preheated oven until it is golden brown and crispy. Meanwhile, heat the sugar syrup and rose water in a saucepan until it thickens slightly. Once the Knafeh is done, pour the sugar syrup over it and let it cool for a few minutes before serving. Finally, garnish with chopped pistachios and enjoy!

recipes.name: Masoob
recipes.cooking_method: To prepare Masoob, follow these steps: 1. Peel and mash ripe bananas in a mixing bowl. 2. Add cooked or canned chickpeas, tahini, honey, and cinnamon powder to the mashed bananas and mix well. 3. In a separate pan, toast bread crumbs until golden brown. 4. Add the toasted bread crumbs to the mixing bowl and stir to combine. 5. Pour milk into the bowl and stir until a smooth, creamy texture is achieved. 6. Chill the mixture in the refrigerator before serving. Enjoy!

recipes.name: Bokhari Rice
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Rinse the basmati rice in cold water and drain it.
2. In a large pot, add the rice, water, and a teaspoon of salt. Bring it to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and let it cook for 15 minutes.
3. While the rice is cooking, heat the clarified butter (ghee) in a separate pot over medium-high heat. Add the chopped onions and minced garlic, and sauté until they're soft and lightly browned.
4. Add the lamb meat to the pot and cook until it's browned on all sides.
5. Add the tomato paste, black pepper, cumin powder, cardamom powder, cinnamon powder, bay leaves, and a teaspoon of salt to the pot, and stir well.
6. Add 2 cups of water to the pot and bring it to a boil. Then reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and let the meat simmer until it's cooked through and tender.
7. Once the rice is cooked, remove it from the heat and let it sit for 10 minutes.
8. Fluff the rice with a fork and transfer it to a large serving dish.
9. Top the rice with the cooked meat and sauce, and serve hot.

recipes.name: Arabian Lamb Stew
recipes.cooking_method: To prepare Basbousa, mix semolina, sugar, baking powder, and melted butter in a bowl. Gradually add in milk until the mixture forms a thick batter. Pour the batter into a greased baking dish and smooth the top with a spatula. Cut the batter into diamond shapes, and place an almond or a pine nut on top of each diamond. Bake in a preheated oven until golden brown. Meanwhile, prepare the syrup by combining sugar, water, and lemon juice in a saucepan and bringing it to a boil. Reduce the heat and let the syrup simmer until thickened. Pour the hot syrup over the hot Basbousa and let it soak for at least 30 minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Dajaj mashwi
recipes.cooking_method: To prepare Dajaj Mashwi, marinate chicken pieces in a mixture of yogurt, lemon juice, garlic, and spices. Let the chicken marinate for at least 30 minutes or up to overnight in the refrigerator. Grill the chicken over charcoal or in a grill pan until cooked through and charred in spots. Serve hot with a side of garlic sauce and pita bread.

recipes.name: Saleeg
ingredients: Ground cinnamon and sugar, for serving
recipes.cooking_method: To prepare Saleeg, first rinse the rice several times in cold water until the water runs clear. Then, combine the rice, water, and salt in a large pot and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and let the rice simmer for about 2-3 hours, stirring occasionally, until the rice is very soft and has a porridge-like consistency. Next, add the milk and continue to cook for another 30-40 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the mixture thickens and the rice is fully cooked. Serve hot with your choice of toppings, such as honey, cinnamon, or butter.

recipes.name: Hininy
recipes.cooking_method: To prepare Hininy, first, soak the barley in water overnight. In a pot, add the soaked barley and cook until it becomes tender. Add milk, sugar, and spices like cinnamon, cardamom, and saffron to the pot and mix well. Let it simmer until the milk thickens and the mixture becomes creamy. Serve hot or cold.

recipes.name: Gursan
recipes.cooking_method: To prepare Gursan, first soak the wheat grains in water overnight. Then, drain the water and grind the wheat to a fine paste. Next, add water to the paste and cook it on low heat, stirring constantly until it thickens. Add sugar and continue cooking until the mixture turns golden brown. Finally, pour the mixture into a greased dish and let it cool. Cut into squares and serve with honey or syrup.

recipes.name: Harees
recipes.cooking_method: Harees is a popular dish in the Middle East made from wheat and meat. To prepare Harees, soak wheat overnight and boil it with water and salt until it is soft. Add meat, such as lamb or chicken, and continue cooking until the meat is tender. Mash the mixture with a pestle until it becomes smooth and creamy. Add ghee or butter and cook for a few more minutes. Serve hot with a sprinkling of cinnamon or sugar on top, if desired.

recipes.name: Shawarma
recipes.cooking_method: To prepare shawarma, start by marinating the meat in a mixture of yogurt, lemon juice, garlic, and spices. Let it sit for several hours or overnight. Then, cook the meat on a rotating spit until it's crispy and browned. Next, prepare the pita bread by heating it up in a pan or oven. Finally, assemble the shawarma by placing the meat and toppings (such as tomato, lettuce, onion, and tahini sauce) in the pita bread and rolling it up tightly. Serve and enjoy!

recipes.name: Maamoul
recipes.cooking_method: To prepare maamoul: In a large bowl, mix together 2 cups fine semolina, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup powdered sugar, and 1 teaspoon active dry yeast until well combined. Add 3/4 cup melted unsalted butter and mix well with your hands until the dough is smooth and elastic. Cover the dough and let it rest for 30 minutes. In a separate bowl, mix together 2 cups chopped walnuts or pistachios, 1/2 cup powdered sugar, and 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon. Set aside. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C). Take a small piece of dough and roll it into a ball about the size of a golf ball. Flatten the ball with your fingers and place 1 teaspoon of the nut mixture in the center. Pinch the edges of the dough together to seal the filling and form a ball. Repeat with the remaining dough and filling. Place the maamoul balls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and bake for 15-20 minutes or until lightly golden. Allow the maamoul to cool completely before serving

recipes.name: Baklava
recipes.cooking_method: To make Baklava, preheat the oven to 350°F. Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish with butter. Unwrap the phyllo dough and place it on a work surface. Cover with a damp cloth to prevent it from drying out. In a separate bowl, mix the chopped walnuts and melted butter. Take a sheet of phyllo dough and brush it with melted butter. Add another sheet on top and brush with butter again. Repeat this process until you have 6 sheets stacked on top of each other. Spread a layer of the walnut mixture over the phyllo dough. Repeat the phyllo dough layering process until you have used all the phyllo dough, brushing each layer with melted butter. Spread the remaining walnut mixture on top. Cut the baklava into diamond or square shapes using a sharp knife. Bake in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until golden brown. In a small saucepan, combine 1 cup of sugar and 1 cup of water. Bring to a boil and stir until the sugar is dissolved. Add 1/2 cup honey and stir well. Let the mixture cool slightly. Pour the syrup over the baked Baklava while it is still hot. Allow to cool before serving.

recipes.name: Arabian Lamb Stew
ingredients: 1 pound of white cheese (e.g. mozzarella or Akkawi cheese)
recipes.cooking_method: To prepare Knafeh, start by mixing together the semolina flour, sugar, baking powder, and ghee until well combined. Next, spread half of the mixture into a greased baking dish and press it down firmly. Then, add the cheese on top, followed by the remaining semolina mixture. Bake the Knafeh in a preheated oven until it is golden brown and crispy. Meanwhile, heat the sugar syrup and rose water in a saucepan until it thickens slightly. Once the Knafeh is done, pour the sugar syrup over it and let it cool for a few minutes before serving. Finally, garnish with chopped pistachios and enjoy!

Bring to a boil and stir until the sugar is dissolved. Add 1/2 cup honey and stir well. Let the mixture cool slightly. Pour the syrup over the baked Baklava while it is still hot. Allow to cool before serving.

recipes.cooking_method: To prepare Knafeh, start by mixing together the semolina flour, sugar, baking powder, and ghee until well combined.
